original: Johansson, John, rektor, Ingelstad, f. 15/2/82 i Nättraby, Blek. 1., av Johan Olsson o. Botilda Svens-son. G. 1. 14 m. Hildur Maria Asproth; 2. 26 m. Anna Lindahl. Barn: Carola f. 16, Hildur 23. — Fodkhögsk. 00, lantman-nask. 01, agronomex. 12, husdjurskon-sulentex. 14. Lantbr :tj :man 01-10, förste liär. v. Ulfhäiltls lantbr:sik. 12-13, extralär. v. Alnarps lantbr :inst. 13-14, förste lär. v. Bollerups lantbr :’sk. 14-16, förest, f. Grimslövs lantmannask. 16-45, rektor v. Ingelstads s€d. 45. Ordf. i komm:fullm. i Skatelöv 19-44, kom-m:nd, fam :ibidraigsnd, eckl. boställsnd i IL distr. sed. 42, fÖTUtv. ordf. i tax:nd o. led. av prövn :nd, ordf. i centr :styr. av JUF 39-44, landstingsman 3<5-38 m. m. Bedrivit omfattande föreläsn :-verksamh., bidr. i tidn. o. tidskr. RVO,
translated: Johansson, John, principal, Ingelstad, born on February 15, 1882, in Nättraby, Blekinge, Sweden, the first-born of Johan Olsson and Botilda Svensson. He was married twice, first for 14 years to Hildur Maria Asproth and then for 26 years to Anna Lindahl. He had two children: Carola, born in 1916, and Hildur, born in 1923. He attended Fodkhögsk. in 1900, lantman-nask. in 1901, agronomex. in 1912, and finally husdjurskon-sulentex. in 1914. He worked as a lantbr :tj:man from 1901 to 1910, was the first teacher at Ulfhäiltls lantbr:sik. from 1912 to 1913, extralär. at Alnarps lantbr:inst. from 1913 to 1914, first teacher at Bollerups lantbr:’sk. from 1914 to 1916, head of the Grimslövs lantmannask. from 1916 to 1945, and finally principal of Ingelstads s€d. since 1945. He was chairman of the Kommunfullmäktige in Skatelöv from 1919 to 1944, a member of the Kommunfam:ibidraigsnd, eckl. boställsnd in IL district since 1942, deputy chairman of the tax committee, a member of the prövn:nd, chairman of the centr:styr. of JUF from 1939 to 1944, and a county councillor from 1935 to 1938, among other roles. He also conducted extensive lecturing activities and contributed to newspapers and magazines. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.

structured.description: John Johansson was a Swedish principal, lecturer, and contributor to newspapers and magazines. He was born on February 15, 1882, in Nättraby, Blekinge, Sweden. He had two children, Carola and Hildur, with his two wives, Hildur Maria Asproth and Anna Lindahl. He attended Fodkhögsk. in 1900, lantman-nask. in 1901, agronomex. in 1912, and finally husdjurskon-sulentex. in 1914. He held various positions such as Lantbr :tj:man, First teacher, Ulfhäiltls lantbr:sik., Extralär., Alnarps lantbr:inst., First teacher, Bollerups lantbr:’sk., Head of Grimslövs lantmannask., and Principal, Ingelstads s€d. He was also a member of various organizations such as the Kommunfullmäktige in Skatelöv, the Kommunfam:ibidraigsnd, eckl. boställsnd in IL district, the tax committee, the Prövn:nd, the Centr:styr. of JUF, and the County Council.
